comments.author: yahoo62278
comments.body: I used the free pick on wunderdog.com for awhile. They usually gave 1 free pick per day and they offered a decent analysis on why they picked who they picked. They also offer a paid version where you can choose packages based on sports you are interested in. I am not vouching for these guys picks, just a site I used a little.

comments.author: alegotardo
comments.body: Quote from: qevokemusic on December 02, 2023, 11:41:26 PMPlease recommend good sites with quality sports predictions and detailed analyses of predictionsI wouldn't want to mention any specific site, as the OP was too broad...It largely depends on the type of sport you want to bet on and also the championships you are following.An analysis site that may be good and quite accurate for football may be terrible for tennis, for example.In addition to these ready-made analysis sites, I also really like following tips from commentators and opinions from other people who don't bet, people who simply do their analysis out of passion for the sport without the commitment of trying to make money from it, I think this type of analysis is very important.Anyway... some sites help, but they cannot be the basis of your bet.

comments.author: Japinat
comments.body: Quote from: cabron on December 03, 2023, 02:05:52 PMThis https://www.sofascore.comThis isn't a prediction site, it's just similar to livescore and flashscore where they provide timely details on the scores on different sports that are live. I mean, if we just follow a prediction from other people or a specific site in this matter, that would simply mean we don't trust our knowledge and skills in sprots betting, which actually what we need to succeed. So it doesn't make sense why we seek on that thing that doesn't help us in the long run.

comments.author: Crypt0Gore
comments.body: OP are you new to sports betting? Most prediction sources I followed are not always accurate and the reason I choose to go this road was because I don't have time to watch sports myself, so my best advice for you is to start watching sports yourself, and also know that with prediction sources you can still lose your money.Predictions or no predictions you need to focus only on what you are willing to risk, do not ever rely on anyone's prediction because you can still lose your money so make sure you risk money you are willing to lose. There are many people that have followed predictions just like me and still they lose most of the time, gambling is something you shouldn't completely rely on to make some income like a real life job, it's all about trying your luck over again until you make it right, so ask yourself how much you will be losing in the trying again and again strategy?
